TextBlock.TextLine: The deposition of Phoebe Chandl'r aged about 12 years:
Testifieth That about a fourthnight before Martha Carrier , was sent for to
Salem to be examined, upon the Sabbath day when the psalm was
singing, s'd Martha Carrier took me s'd deponent by the shoulder & shaked
me, in the meeting house & asked me where I lived: but I made her noe
answere, (not doubting but that she knew me, having lived some time the
next door to my fathers house, on one side of the way) & that day that
s'd Martha
Carrier was ceased, my mother sent me to Carry some
bear to the folks that were att work in the lott, & when I came within
the fence there was a voice in the bushes(which I thought was Martha
Martha Carriers voice, which I knowe well) but saw noe body, & the voice asked
me, what I did there & whether I was going: which greatly frighted
me
soe that I run as fast as I could to those att work, & told them
what I had heard, about an hour & half, or two hours after, my
mother sent me again upon the same occasion, to the workmen aboves'd
and Coming home, near the place aboves'd where I heard that
voice before
I should
be
I heard the same voice, as I judged, over my head, saying
poysoned
happened
within two or three days, accordingly
as I Conceive, for I went to my sister Allens farm the same
which
day, and on friday following, about one half of my right hand was
greatly swolen & exceeding painfull, & allsoe part of my face, which
I can give noe account how it Came
days, & severall times
upon my breast,
I have been troubled with a great weight
& Continued very bad some
soe that
& upon my leggs,
I could hardly
when I have been going about,
And the last sabbath day was seaven night, I went to meeting very well
goe, which I have told my mother of:
in the morning, & went to my place where I used to sitt (the ministers
not being
Come)
very earnestly upon me,
& Richard
Carrier son of aboves'd Martha looked
been poy-soned as aboves'd, began to pain me greatly,
& imediately my hand which had formerly
burning att my stomake,
hear any of the
the singing:
prayer, nor singing, tell the two or three last words
& then was struck deaf that I could not
& I had a strange
Jurat in Curia
Phoebe
her mark
M
Chandler
Bridget Chandler aged 40 years Mother to the s'd Phoebe
Testifieth that in the day of
it her daughter
Complained as above is Expressed.
Jurat in Curia
